title: Periodic function
summary: A periodic function  is a function that repeats its values at regular intervals. For example, the trigonometric functions, which repeat at intervals of 2 Ï€ {\displaystyle 2\pi } radians, are periodic functions. Periodic functions are used throughout science to describe oscillations, waves, and other phenomena that exhibit periodicity. Any function that is not periodic is called aperiodic.
